intro: Dryopteris simplicifrons, commonly known as the simple-crested wood fern, is a species of fern native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically dark green and have a slightly curled appearance. The plant prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are clustered on the underside of the fronds. Dryopteris simplicifrons plays an important role in forest ecosystems by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
